channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for FL

item.title: Report X-2024040798
item.description:
Report X-2024040798

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-14
  • City: POMPANO BEACH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found in the HazMat Cage during morning audit. It was not sent as hazardous but someone wrote "leaking HazMat" on the box. It was later confirmed to be hazardous. DescribePack: The plastic jug's cap was loose and leaked within the box. Bottom of the box had failed due to leakage. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Someone had already placed the box within a red tote and HazMat bag inside the HazMat Cage.

DescribePack: Bottle was crushed & had loose lid resulted to leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg. received damaged off trailer 808227, out of 305-MARI-A. Pkg. taken to QA for inspection. DescribePack: Upon inspecting container, it was noted the there was a crack on the bottom which caused about 4 oz. of liquid to leak out. Plastic Pail was not shipped in a fiberboard box. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: pail is inside a plastic bag in a bin, awaiting instructions from PGH.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was punctured, but not able to determine what punctured the package. This cause contents to leak from package. Package was set aside and placed in a hazmat bin. DescribePack: Small puncture hole. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Ensure package stayed upright.

item.title: Report X-2024040896
item.description:
Report X-2024040896

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-11
  • City: PANAMA CITY
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package had gotten wet on the bottom from rain, handlers disregarded arrows and placed package upside down, and dropped the package onto the tugger where it was brought to QA. The drop caused the seals on the bottles to burst and caused the cleaner liquid to spill from the caps, package handler had liquid spill onto him. Had first aid for exposure done, no injury report filed. DescribePack: Package had orientation arrows ignored and was dropped on the wrong side, causing the liquid to break the seals within the bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a tote and placed properly following arrows, then was promptly moved into the hazardous cage for inspection.

The lids were secured but liquid content were still seeping through lids. DescribePack: Bottles had defective lids which resulted to leakage. The lids were secured but liquid content were still seeping through lids. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

Package was undeclared hazmat due to shipping label covering corrosive diamond label. DescribePack: Bottles were crushed & had loose lids resulted to leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2024040574
item.description:
Report X-2024040574

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package arrived already wet to the station, then it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment and inspection. DescribePack: Both plastic bottles of Noble Chemical Power Liquid Machine Detergent leaked from loose caps. About 20 ounces were released. The caps were not secured. The shipper did not use padding and/ or inner packaging materials. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon arrival of the wet package, it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment. No release was found.

RESPONDER OPENED THE PACKAGE AND SAW THAT IT WAS A HAZMAT. AEROSOLS, NON-FLAMMABLE; PACKAGE COVERED IN PLASTIC WRAP AND INNER BOX MARKED WITH GROUND LTD QTY MARKING

item.title: Report E-2024040378
item.description:
Report E-2024040378

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-28
  • City: LAKELAND
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 28, 2024, four (4) 1-gallon cans of paint were crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Alpha-Omega Training Compliance (AOTC) to remediate the site. Crews downstacked the pallet to find the source of the release, and they found one (1) damaged cardboard box that contained four (4) 1-gallon cans had been crushed, so crews removed the box and its contents for waste. The product had leaked onto the outside of some of the other cardboard boxes, but the product had already dried. One (1) 55-gallon drum that contained the damaged cardboard box, four (4) impacted cans, and PPE was labeled and staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

item.title: Report X-2024040622
item.description:
Report X-2024040622

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-18T18:14:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-08
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 1. X-2024040622 SequenceEvent: Package was loaded into 391 truck when the driver noticed the package was leaking. The driver immediately altered QA about the package. QA then removed the package from the loaders to be processed. DescribePack: Two of the caps of Zep Calcium, Lime & Rust Stain Remover was not tight enough and caused internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Removing the package immediately. 2. X-2024040624 SequenceEvent: Package was under the 400 belt when the package was found leaking. QA quickly found the package and removed it from the area. DescribePack: Both of the caps of Zep Industrial Purple Degreaser were not sealed tight enough and caused internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Removing the package away immediately from the PH.

item.description:
Report E-2024040317

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-11
  • City: DORAL BRANCH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS AIR CARGO FACILITY IN MIAMI, FLORIDA, CONTENTS OF A BLACK SHRINK WRAPPED SKID WAS INSPECTED PRIOR TO AIR MOVEMENT TO PANAMA. REMOVAL OF SHRINK-WRAPPING REVEALS MULTIPLE BOXES WITH UN3481 LITHIUM-ION BATTERY MARKS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BLACK SHRINK-WRAPPING. THE SIGNED AIR WAYBILL OFFERED WITH SHIPMENT DOES NOT INDICATE LITHIUM ION BATTERIES IN COMPLIANCE WITH SECTION II OF PI 967.

item.title: Report X-2024040446

The lids were defective due to being secure but still leaking liquid content. The plastic plug seal beneath lid was also defective. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.
